data.title: Autocomplete allows CTRL-Z (undo) in textbox
data.body:
The autocomplete feature allows CTRL-Z (undo) shortcut in it's textbox.. I don't know if that's how it's supposed to be...

![bug3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4069263/5783215/58a5e9f0-9dc1-11e4-808d-2437be190bbb.png)

Example (html): When I typed `body` once and pressed enter, the next time I enter something, I can use CTRL-Z to revert the content of the little textbox to `body` again.

data.title: Allow opening of readonly files
data.body:
- Checks that it can open as read rather than read/write; this will fix the `EPERM` and `EBUSY` errors on read.
- Makes the error better for `EPERM` and `EBUSY` errors when they do happen on save

Closes #5102 
Closes #5107 
Closes #5112 
Closes #3231

data.title: Consider replacing :lipstick: in the git commit message emoji guide?
data.body:
We recently adopted the awesome [git commit message emoji guide](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/97d697f1952eaa4bb0d5d71f4895877183ad53ba/CONTRIBUTING.md#git-commit-messages) outlined in atom's CONTRIBUTING.md for our own projects but a coworker felt uncomfortable because :lipstick: is a gendered form of beauty (and while some men do wear lipstick, [makeup is a very different experience for women](http://faculty.georgetown.edu/tannend/nyt062093.htm)). I also felt uncomfortable once it was pointed out.

In our own version we chose to use :rose: instead as an un-gendered form of beauty and I figured I should raise the issue 'upstream' too. :sparkles:

data.title: Add ._* to ignored file names
data.body:
Macs generate ._ files when saving to a filesystem other then HFS
In shared environments this is a big problem

data.title: Path too long exception on Windows install
data.body:
I download AtomSetup.exe
I run it as an administrator
I agree there are probably curious permission setups and my user directory is mapped to a central server.
I get no choices where to install from the installer.
Other applications have worked
I get the error dialog. Here's the log. 
I can't alter where it tries to install, nor am I clear why the install path is too long.
Chocolatey didn't  install 174.1 either - there's clearly something pathological in my setup.
Any chance of being able to configure where it installs to and from?

data.title: Atom can no longer open readonly files
data.body:
I have been using Atom on a project where files are managed by a Perforce depot. That means that all files are marked as readonly until they are checked out by Perforce. On my Mac machine, this means that only the read flag is set in the file permissions.

Up until today, I was able to open these readonly files in Atom to view its contents, just like any normal file. I could even save to the readonly files, with Atom giving me an extra prompt to let me know that I'm overwriting a readonly file.

But as of today, that has completely changed. When I attempt to open up the readonly file, instead of the file opening in the Atom editor, I instead get the following error message on the top right corner: _"Permission denied '/my/path/to/file'"_. Perhaps there was some sort of Atom update released today or this week that changed its functionality. I would say that it is quite desirable to be able to open up readonly files, at least for just reading if not writing. All other major text editors, especially Sublime, support viewing readonly files.

Note that I could probably use `sudo atom` to get superuser access and be able to read/write files that are readonly, but needlessly relying on root is not the best idea.

data.title: Auto-indent on paste misbehaviour (javascript): next line after "if" statement w/o braces
data.body:
``` javascript
if (true)
  a = b
  return
```

"Return" should have the same indent as "if"

data.title: Auto-indent misbehaviour (javascript): object inside of an array
data.body:
This auto-formatted incorrectly

``` javascript
[
  'two spaces indent',
{} //object placed two spaces to the left, expected to have the same indentation as text
]
```

data.title: Keymap resolver reports keys according to US layout when on sv_SE layout
data.body:
When I use the keymap resolver, all keys except for alphabetic are mapped according to US keyboard layout:

Example in keymap resolver
pressing < shows up as \ 
pressing shift-7 (which should be /) shows up as & 
pressing å shows up as ]
pressing ö shows up as ;
pressing ä shows up as '

When I use Dvorak(sv) I get a similar behaviour but it seems the non-alpha keys are mapped to the US key that would be where the swedish key would be:

For example, pressing the key that would be 'q' in qwerty (and which should be å in dvorak) maps to ']', which is on the same position on US keyboard as 'å' is on a normal swedish keyboard.

This is Atom 0.174.0 on Arch linux. Shortcuts and keys work just fine in all other applications.

data.title: Can't use Github for mac and Chrome with Atom together.
data.body:
Recently I use atom to coding in my work. But after some time, I found Github for mac can't push, pull sync, commit. It also tell me file exists or something. At the mean time Goolge Chrome browser cant load any page either. Quit atom, all things get back. Github can commit, pull, push, sync, and Chrome can load page. I don't know what happened, but every time this happen, I just restart atom.

Atom version: 0.16x ~ 0.17x, I can't remember if an ealier version had this issue.

Here's my installed packages.

```
atom-beautify
auto-update-packages
autocomplete-gocode
autocomplete-paths
autocomplete-plus
autocomplete-snippets
compass
emmet
file-icons
git-plus
hex
project-manager
save-session
seti-syntax
seti-ui
webbox-color
```

data.title: cpu usage kept high
data.body:
I'm on 0.174.0, Windows 7

I installed some 3rd party plugins, but disabled all of them

I'm behind of company firewall, so I set up proxy in .apmrc

However, cpu usage always kept high since 0.166.0, I've no idea what happened

data.title: Atom loses language-specific configs
data.body:
## Steps to Reproduce
1. Start Atom (normally or in safe mode)
2. Change CoffeeScript Tab Length config (Settings→Packages→language-coffee-script→Tab Length)
3. Restart Atom
4. Observe CoffeeScript Tab Length config has reverted

Alternately: 
1. Start Atom
2. Add the following to config.cson and save:
   
   ``` cson
   '.coffee.source':
     'editor':
       'tabLength': 3
   ```
3. Observe indent guides change to three spaces
4. Restart Atom
5. Observe `.coffee.source` configs are missing, indent guides have reverted

**Atom Version**: 0.174.0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.10.1
## Config

Verified this happens even with a blank config: 

``` cson
"*":
  "exception-reporting":
    userId: "ef120142-1f00-4aba-80ca-3bebf3c8a8dc"
  welcome:
    showOnStartup: false
```
## Installed Packages

```
# Dev
find-and-replace@0.155.0

# User
atom-beautify@0.21.2
atom-prairie-twilight-dark-syntax@0.0.0
autocomplete-plus@1.1.0
base16-ocean-dark-spacegray@0.9.0
base16-ocean-light-syntax@0.1.0
base64@0.1.0
color-picker@1.2.6
emmet@2.3.2
gist-it@0.6.3
git-plus@4.3.1
layout-manager@0.2.3
linter@0.10.0
linter-bootlint@0.0.3
linter-htmlhint@0.0.8
linter-jshint@0.1.0
linter-tidy@0.0.1
merge-conflicts@1.2.8
minimap@3.5.5
prairie-dawn-syntax@0.30.0
prairie-dusk-syntax@0.30.0
regex-railroad-diagram@0.6.3
solarized-dark-syntax@0.30.0
```

data.title: Uncaught Error: socket hang up
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
1. Have flaky internet connection
2. Go to Settings > Install

Comes along with issue #5093 

**Atom Version**: 0.170.0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.10.1
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught Error: socket hang up

```
At events.js:85

Error: socket hang up
  at createHangUpError (_http_client.js:214:15)
  at TLSSocket.socketCloseListener (_http_client.js:246:23)
  at TLSSocket.emit (events.js:129:20)
  at TCP.close (net.js:469:12)

```
### Commands

```
     -6:41.4 core:move-right (atom-text-editor.editor)
     -6:39.0 core:move-left (atom-text-editor.editor)
     -6:32.0 core:move-right (atom-text-editor.editor)
     -6:31.2 editor:newline (atom-text-editor.editor)
  5x -6:18.0 core:move-right (atom-text-editor.editor)
  2x -6:13.7 core:save (atom-text-editor.editor)
  2x -6:05.9 core:backspace (atom-text-editor.editor)
  2x -6:05.2 core:save (atom-text-editor.editor)
     -0:28.2 tree-view:toggle (div.settings-view.pane-item)
 67x -0:00.0 core:backspace (atom-text-editor#editor.fontFamily.editor.mini)
```
### Config

``` json
{
  "core": {
    "disabledPackages": [
      "linter-gjslint",
      "linter",
      "linter-dartanalyzer"
    ]
  },
  "editor": {
    "fontFamily": "Source Code Pro, Menlo, monospace",
    "fontSize": 18,
    "autoIndentOnPaste": false,
    "invisibles": {}
  }
}
```
### Installed Packages

``` coffee
atom-beautify, v0.21.2
```

data.title: Atom Windows Installer Deletes User Path
data.body: The latest Atom Windows installer completely overwrites the user's `PATH` environment variable with `c:\Users\<user>\AppData\Local\atom\bin`.

data.title: Ogg files shown as text file
data.body:
An ogg file in the working directory showed up some garbage text..
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8568726/5770429/390a63da-9d50-11e4-9047-560363f2e47c.png)

data.title: Uncaught Error: ENOENT, open '<Path>/index.html'
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
1. ...
2. ...

**Atom Version**: 0.169.0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.10.1
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught Error: ENOENT, open '<Path>/index.html'

```
At /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/pathwatcher/node_modules/q/q.js:126

Error: ENOENT, open '<Path>/index.html'
  at Error (native)

```
### Commands

```
     -9:29.7 core:backspace (atom-text-editor.editor)
  2x -5:47.8 core:save (atom-text-editor.editor)
  7x -4:10.5 core:backspace (atom-text-editor.editor)
     -4:03.9 core:save (atom-text-editor.editor)
     -3:29.6 core:backspace (atom-text-editor.editor)
     -3:28.6 core:save (atom-text-editor.editor)
     -0:06.1 core:cut (atom-text-editor.editor)
     -0:02.4 core:undo (atom-text-editor.editor)
     -0:00.0 core:save (atom-text-editor.editor)
```
### Config

``` json
{
  "core": {
    "disabledPackages": [
      "lesscompile"
    ]
  },
  "editor": {
    "fontSize": 14
  }
}
```
### Installed Packages

``` coffee
# User
linter, v0.8.0

# Dev
No dev packages
```

data.title: Hard crash when hitting enter twice in JSX grammar (provided by a package)
data.body:
See orktes/atom-react#21. 

I'm reporting to core too because this causes a hard crash of Atom instead of just an exception. It seems bad that a package can take down the whole editor. Also I couldn't get a stacktrace, but I have clear repro steps.

/cc @zgotsch

data.title: Uncaught Error: Atom can only handle files < 2MB for now.
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
1. ...
2. ...

**Atom Version**: 0.172.0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.10.1
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught Error: Atom can only handle files < 2MB for now.

```
At /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/project.js:360

Error: Atom can only handle files < 2MB for now.
  at Project.module.exports.Project.buildBuffer (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/project.js:360:15)
  at Project.module.exports.Project.bufferForPath (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/project.js:337:63)
  at Project.module.exports.Project.open (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/project.js:291:19)
  at Workspace.module.exports.Workspace.openURIInPane (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/workspace.js:487:29)
  at Workspace.module.exports.Workspace.open (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/workspace.js:414:19)
  at Ipc.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/window-event-handler.js:45:32)
  at Ipc.emit (events.js:110:17)
  at process.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/atom/renderer/api/lib/ipc.js:22:29)
  at process.emit (events.js:118:17)

```
### Commands

```
```
### Config

``` json
{
  "core": {
    "themes": [
      "atom-dark-ui",
      "solarized-dark-syntax"
    ]
  },
  "editor": {
    "fontSize": 18,
    "showInvisibles": true,
    "showIndentGuide": true,
    "tabLength": 4,
    "softWrap": true,
    "softWrapAtPreferredLineLength": true,
    "invisibles": {}

}
```

data.title: Check if files are accessible during deserialization
data.body:
If a buffer's serialized path was a directory upon deserialization then Atom would previously fail to launch.

Now these invalid buffers are ignored and deserialization can complete successfully.

Fixes #4199
Fixes #4939
Fixes #5084
